publicationStmt.p: This is a tokenized version of the XML-TEI markup of the original publications by SIL Mexico for the purposes of: archival and for the creation of a body of Mixtepec-Mixtec language resources (LR) (ISO: mix). Encoded documents used with the permission of original authors.Tokenized version made for purpose of enabling standoff annotations.

notesStmt.note: Este libro trata acerca de algunos conceptos básicos y generales de cómo es el mundo y su forma, cuando éste está dibujado en un planisferio. También incluye una descripción básica sobre países y continentes, conceptos como los puntos cardinales y cómo éstos se usan en el estudio de los mapas.

sourceDesc.bibl:
Tutu ña sna'a nixi sku'a ñayivi Beckmann, Gisela; Nieves, María M.. 2009. (2nd ed.). Instituto Lingüístico de Verano, A.C. Tlalpan, D.F., México
linguistic consultation Marina Ramos López Prof. Wilfrido López Hernández Prof. Mendoza Santiago, Francisco
Obtained from:

elementSpec.desc:
In this document as well as the others in the document set that have numbers in their digit form, digits ([0-9] etc.) are encapsulated in the "num" (number) element to most accurately express the semantic contents; The "num" elements in the TEI-XML markup of these documets may be given the following attributes:
'@value' (used to provide info for the exact numeric value, (this is redundant to the contents of element and may not be necessary and later versions of this encoding may not include this).
'@corresp' (given that many of the exercises in this document include numeric and prose presentations of the same problems, the @'corresp' is used to provide link between the written (orthographic) form of the number and the digit it represents;)
Where the page divisions in the original documents are, this encoding uses "div" (division) elements; this is to separate the linguistic, and knowledge data from formatting

All images from SIL-Mexico publications are encoded in TEI 'graphic' elements. Each is identified in attribute: @'url. In final output, the goal is to annotate/encode image and the semantic contents represented according to one or more Linked Open Data compatible metadata markup formats.

revisionDesc.change: Added the abstract in Spanish which is included in the publications but was originally left out of the XML encoding.

front.ab: Este libro trata acerca de algunos conceptos básicos y generales de cómo es el mundo y su forma, cuando éste está dibujado en un planisferio.También incluye una descripción básica sobre países y continentes, conceptos como los puntos cardinales y cómo éstos se usan en el estudio de los mapas.

spanGrp.span: The Earth is shaped like an orange.
La Tierra tiene la forma como una naranja.
It is always turning on an invisible thing that exists called "the equator".
Siempre está girando en por la cosa invisible que existe ye que se llama "el eje".
It holds up like a straight tree.
And at the end of one part of the "axis" it is called "the north pole", and then on the other side of the other axis, it is called "the south pole".
Here is a small thing that shows the four cardinal directions such as: north, south, east and west.
Now, what direction is it showing that are we facing?
¿Ahora, en cual dirección muestra que nos estamos enfrentando?
The cardinal directions are shown as north, south, east and west.
Las direcciónes cardinales son mostradas como norte, sur, este y oeste.
The sun is rising on the right side.
El sol sube por el lado derecho.
Look at the boy that is in the middle of the directions.
Mira el niño pequeño que está entre las direcciónes.
The direction outward from the boy's face is called the North, and the South is the the direction in back of him.
And we see again that the sun is on the west and that the boy's hand is at the east.
Recall that the earth is shaped like an orange.
Recuerda que la tierra tiene la forma de una naranja.
"The equator" is that which divides the earth in half between the north and south.
And we say that is its an invisible thing but that it exists.
See that the poles and the hemispheres are different.
Mira que los polos y hemisferios son diferentes.
And "Hemosphere" means half of the earth (read page 8).
It cuts a straight line in the middle of the Earth between the east and west.
The right side is called "the Eastern Hemosphere", and the left side is called "the Western Hemosphere".
La parte derecha se llama "el hemisferio oriental", y la parte izquierda se llama "el hemisferio occidental".
Here are both sides, the west and the east.
We see that there are two sides.
The land where America is is the west (western hemisphere).
And Europe and Africa are in the east (eastern hemisphere).
Why is there day and night?
Porqué hay el día y la noche?
We already know that this earth is shaped like an orange.
There's land and water on the earth.
Hay tierra y agua en la Tierra.
There are small lands called "islands" and they are located in the middle of water.
And the big lands are called "continents".
There are six continents called: Africa, America, Antartica, Asia, Europe and Oceania.
There is a "continent" called America in the Western hemisphere.
And half of this continent is located in the north and half in the south.
No people live on the continent Antartica because there is a lot of very cold ice.
There are four continents in the eastern hemisphere.
Hay cuatro continentes en hemisferio oriental.
And these are Europe, Africa, Asia, and Oceania.
Recall that a continent is a big land.
And there are 31 large lands called "states" in Mexico.
And there are another thirteen small lands in the middle of the water near Baja California.
It borders on the state called Chiapas and Veracruz.
On the map below there is an ocean called "the pacific ocean".
These are the directions? that boarder with Oaxaca.
See that Canada and the United Stated are located to the north.
Mira que la Canadá y los Estados Unidos estan situados al norte.
And Mexico is located to the south of the United States.
Y México está al sur de los Estados Unidos.
There are fifty states in the United States.
Hay cincuenta estados en los Estados Unidos.
Many people from our town live there with their children.
Mucha gente de nuestro pais viven allí con sus niños.
People go to cities all over the United States.
There people speak different languages like Spanish, Portuguese, French, Quechua and other languages.
Allí la gente hablan idiomas diferentes como, español, portugués, francés, quechua, y várias otras idioms.
There is a very big and old forest on the Earth called "the Amazon".
